page.title: 08 Worlebury hill fort
page.content: Worlebury hill fort lies in Weston woods and can be easily reached from Kewstoke road. Today the ruined outer walls can still be seen as well as finds now in Woodspring museum. Iron age man chose to settle on Worlebury hill for a number of reasons.At the top of the hill they had a good view and would be able to see their enemies coming. The land was good for growing crops and they could go fishing in the sea. The hill used to be surrounded by a large stone wall. It would have kept out wolves and enemies. Inside the walls were huts. These were round with wattle and daub walls and thatched roofs.There was a small door and a fire in the middle of the room.Iron age man would have spent his day ploughing, sewing, weeding, harvesting and threshing.They also kept animals.
